page.title: 05LOCAL STORIES
page.content: {Curing a Sore} Long ago to cure a sore, a piece of meat would be put on it.Some strange gaelic words were said and then the piece of meat would be buried! If the sore didn't heal the meat was said to be too fatty. {The Island Of Eilean Hoan Just off Durness is the small uninhabited island of Eilean Hoan. On this small island are the remains of an old graveyard. Long ago when vicious wolves roamed the Highlands the people of Durness buried their dead on the island. They feared the wolves would dig up the graves and eat the bodies if they were buried on the mainland. {The Missing Dog One day a dog fell into Smoo Cave. Some time later the dog appeared at Sarsgrum with no hair on it's body.
